revised_title: The 1883 Krakatoa Volcanic Eruption and Its Aftermath in the Sunda Strait
tldr: The 1883 Krakatoa volcanic eruption in the Sunda Strait caused massive destruction, with enormous columns of smoke, ash, and pumice stone being released. The eruption led to the formation of new islands, subsidence of existing ones, and significant damage to surrounding areas, including the loss of life and infrastructure.
